targets.expr: avg(100 - ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/", fstype!="rootfs"} * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/", fstype!="rootfs"}))

avg(100 - ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/mnt/disk-2", fstype!="rootfs"} * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/mnt/disk-2", fstype!="rootfs"}))

avg(100 - ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/mnt/disk-3", fstype!="rootfs"} * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/mnt/disk-3", fstype!="rootfs"}))

panels.description: Total RAM
panels.title: RAM Total / Available

panels.description: Total number of CPU cores
panels.title: CPU Cores

panels.description: System uptime
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description:
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
IOWait - Waiting for I/O to complete
IRQ - Servicing interrupts
SoftIRQ - Servicing softirqs
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Idle - Waiting for something to happen
panels.title: CPU Utilization by Mode

panels.description: Total number of CPU cores
panels.title: CPU Cores

panels.description: Total RAM
panels.title: RAM Total / Available

panels.description:
Apps - Memory used by user-space applications

PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses

SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified

Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)

Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache

Buffers - Block device (e.g. harddisk) cache

Unused - Free memory unassigned

Swap - Swap space used

Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.expr: avg((node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"} - node_memory_MemFree_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"} - node_memory_Buffers_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"} - node_memory_Cached_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"} - node_memory_Slab_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"} - node_memory_PageTables_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"} - node_memory_SwapCached_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}))

panels.title: Average Memory Stack

panels.description:
Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list

Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)

Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list

Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs
panels.title: Average Memory Active / Inactive Detail

panels.description:
Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes

Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
panels.title: Average Memory Active / Inactive

panels.description:
Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk

WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers

Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk
panels.title: Memory Writeback and Dirty

panels.description:
Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mapped, such as libraries

Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)

ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages

ShmemPmdMapped - Amount of shared (shmem/tmpfs) memory backed by huge pages

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages
ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages

panels.title: Average Memory Shared and Mapped

panels.description:
Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system

CommitLimit - Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
panels.title: Average Memory Committed

panels.description:
AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages

AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files
panels.title: Memory Anonymous

panels.description:
KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable

PerCPU - Per CPU memory allocated dynamically by loadable modules

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Average Memory Kernel / CPU

panels.description:
Pagesin - Page in operations

Pagesout - Page out operations
panels.title: Average Memory Pages In / Out

panels.description:
Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

Pgmajfault - Major page fault operations

Pgminfault - Minor page fault operations

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

panels.title: Average Memory Page Faults

panels.description:
SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure

SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
panels.title: Average Memory Slab
Softnet Out of Quota by Instance
Softnet Out of Quota by CPU

panels.description:
TCP_alloc - Allocated sockets

TCP_inuse - Tcp sockets currently in use

TCP_mem - Used memory for tcp

TCP_orphan - Orphan sockets

TCP_tw - Sockets waiting close

targets.expr: sum(node_sockstat_TCP_alloc{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}) by (instance) + sum(node_sockstat_TCP_inuse{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}) by (instance) + sum(node_sockstat_TCP_mem{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}) by (instance) + sum(node_sockstat_TCP_orphan{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}) by (instance) + sum(node_sockstat_TCP_tw{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}) by (instance)

panels.title: Sockstat TCP by Instance

panels.description:
TCP_alloc - Allocated sockets

TCP_inuse - Tcp sockets currently in use

TCP_mem - Used memory for tcp

TCP_orphan - Orphan sockets

TCP_tw - Sockets waiting close
panels.title: Sockstat TCP by Type

panels.description:
UDPLITE_inuse - Udplite sockets currently in use

UDP_inuse - Udp sockets currently in use

UDP_mem - Used memory for udp
panels.title: Sockstat UDP by Instance

panels.description:
UDPLITE_inuse - Udplite sockets currently in use

UDP_inuse - Udp sockets currently in use

UDP_mem - Used memory for udp
panels.title: Sockstat UDP by Type

panels.description:
mem_bytes - TCP sockets in that state

mem_bytes - UDP sockets in that state

FRAG_memory - Used memory for frag
panels.title: Sockstat Memory Size by Instance

panels.description:
mem_bytes - TCP sockets in that state

mem_bytes - UDP sockets in that state

FRAG_memory - Used memory for frag
panels.title: Sockstat Memory Size by Type

panels.description: Sockets currently in use
panels.title: Sockstat Used
Netstat IP In / Out Octets by Instance
Netstat IP In / Out Octets by Type

panels.description:
InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors

OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
panels.title: ICMP In / Out by Instance

panels.description:
InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors

OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
panels.title: ICMP In / Out by Type
TCP / UDP In / Out by Instance

panels.description:
InUDP - Datagrams received

OutUDP - Datagrams sent

InTCP- Segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections

OutTCP - Segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets
panels.title: UDP / TCP In / Out by Type

panels.description:
ListenOverflows - Times the listen queue of a socket overflowed

ListenDrops - SYNs to LISTEN sockets ignored

TCPSynRetrans - SYN-SYN/ACK retransmits to break down retransmissions in SYN, fast/timeout retransmits

RetransSegs - Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets

targets.expr: sum(irate(node_netstat_TcpExt_ListenOverflows{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance) + sum(irate(node_netstat_TcpExt_ListenDrops{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance) + sum(irate(node_netstat_TcpExt_TCPSynRetrans{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance) + sum(irate(node_netstat_Tcp_RetransSegs{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance) + sum(irate(node_netstat_Tcp_InErrs{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance) + sum(irate(node_netstat_Tcp_OutRsts{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance) + sum(irate(node_netstat_TcpExt_TCPOFOQueue{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance)

panels.title: TCP Errors by Instance

panels.description:
ListenOverflows - Times the listen queue of a socket overflowed

ListenDrops - SYNs to LISTEN sockets ignored

TCPSynRetrans - SYN-SYN/ACK retransmits to break down retransmissions in SYN, fast/timeout retransmits

RetransSegs - Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets

InErrs - Segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums)

OutRsts - Segments sent with RST flag

TCPOFOQueue - TCP layer receives an out of order packet and has enough memory to queue it
panels.title: TCP Errors by Type

panels.description:
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state

PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state
panels.title: TCP Direct Transition by Instance

panels.description:
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state

PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state
panels.title: TCP Direct Transition by Type

panels.description: CP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
panels.title: CurrEstab TCP Connections by Instance

panels.description: CP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
panels.title: Total CurrEstab TCP Connections

targets.expr: (node_filesystem_size_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/"} - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/"}) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{job="superset-node-exporter", instance=~"$instance", mountpoint="/"} * 100

panels.description: The number (after merges) of I/O requests completed per second for the device
panels.title: Disk IOps Completed by Instance

panels.description: The number (after merges) of I/O requests completed per second for the device
panels.title: Disk IOps Completed by Device

panels.description: The number (after merges) of I/O requests completed per second for the device
panels.title: Average Disk IOps Completed
